definition: no time to deal with it (idiom); caught unprepared
to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
(negative prefix)/not/no
and/to reach/up to/in time for

sentences.english: The rampant and absurd behavior that prince 2 for people unprepared.
sentences.chinese: 這猖獗而荒唐的行爲叫馬王二人一時措手不及。

sentences.english: But nothing could have prepared visitors for the amount or duration of the bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 但這持續漫長的惡劣天氣確實讓遊客們有些措手不及。

sentences.english: The opponent was wrong-footed by his passing backhand.
sentences.chinese: 他的對手被他一記漂亮的反手球打得措手不及。

sentences.english: And it was such a young, quite innocent, sweet thing to say, that I kind of caught myself off-guard.
sentences.chinese: 聽着特別年輕和天真，我有點措手不及。

sentences.english: Gumshoe came to him in the past unaware.
sentences.chinese: 悄悄走過去給他來個措手不及。

sentences.english: Her betrayal took me completely off guard.
sentences.chinese: 她的背叛讓我完全措手不及。

sentences.english: I caught him off guard when I ran into him and we both fell to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 趁他措手不及，我衝向他，我兩都倒在地上。

sentences.english: The railway companies had all been caught completely unprepared by the sudden snow falls.
sentences.chinese: 暴風雪突降讓毫無準備的鐵路公司全都措手不及。

sentences.english: The backwash of the passing boat took us a surprise.
sentences.chinese: 那艘經過的船造成的回浪讓我們措手不及。

sentences.english: " Why that all of a sudden?" Cheng Fan is a little" be taken by surprise".
sentences.chinese: “怎麼突然問這個呀？”程帆有點“措手不及”。

sentences.english: That's the last time I get caught flatfooted.
sentences.chinese: 那是我最後一次感到措手不及。

sentences.english: Know the truth, Benny surprise, cartoon family into confusion.
sentences.chinese: 得知真相後，班尼措手不及，卡通家族陣腳大亂。

sentences.english: She suddenly interposes such a serious issue which is unprepared for Jack.
sentences.chinese: 她突然冒出這麼一句來，讓傑克措手不及。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold and WuYunZhao appear suddenly, Yang ling kill caught unprepared.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金與伍雲召忽然出現，將楊林殺了個措手不及。

sentences.english: Companies and the government are unprepared.
sentences.chinese: 公司和政府對在線攻擊措手不及。

sentences.english: At the beginning of the match, we surprised the visiting team.
sentences.chinese: 比賽剛一開始，我們就打了客隊一個措手不及。

definition: to be caught off guard/without warning
not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
utterly defeated
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
(idiom) to become agitated/to get worked up
to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
to get agitated/to panic
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
surprise attack
to deal with/to manage/to proceed
